info.title: Smart Pension API
info.description: This is the endpoint description of Smart Pension API.

scopes.customer:
Manage the customer's company.
- Create postponements
- Create and import contributions
- Edit company details
- Add and edit employees
scopes.user:
Manage all companies linked to the user's adviser.
- Manage adviser details
- Add and edit adviser's users
- Create and import contributions for any company managed by the adviser
scopes.employee:
Manage the employee account.
- List employee contributions
- Edit employee details and preferences

event_on.description: The date when the enrolment happens. The staging date cannot be set via this parameter. PATCH and POST are available to update/create a re-enrolment date only.

gross_qualifying_earnings.description: The gross qualifying earnings of the employee. It is **required** if you want Smart Pension to define the employee category. Format: float with two decimals.

period_type.description: The length of the pay reference period.

starts_on.description: The start of the pay reference period.

ends_on.description: The end of the pay reference period.

category.description: *Amendments to this value via a PATCH requests are ignored*. The worker category during the pay reference period. It is **required** only if `gross_qualifying_earnings` is not provided. The "No Duties" category is used to identify exempted employees

pensionable_earnings.description: *Amendments to this value via a PATCH requests are ignored*. The pensionable earnings of the employee. It is **required** only if `gross_qualifying_earnings` is not provided. Format: float with two decimals.

employee_amount.description: *Amendments to this value via a PATCH requests are ignored*. The employee contribution amount for the pay reference period. It is **required** only if `gross_qualifying_earnings` is not provided. Format: float with two decimals.

company_amount.description: *Amendments to this value via a PATCH requests are ignored*. The company contribution amount for the pay reference period. It is **required** only if `gross_qualifying_earnings` is not provided. Format: float with two decimals.

voluntary_amount.description: *Amendments to this value via a PATCH requests are ignored*. The additional voluntary contribution (AVC) amount for the pay reference period. Format: float with two decimals.

scheme_starts_on.description: Company staging date or duties start date

automatic_postponement_period.description: This option will automatically create a postponement with the provided period length when any new employee is created.

pensionable_earning_type.description: It defines how pensionable earnings are calculated. More information about each type can be found here: [Pensionable Earning Support Page](http://support.autoenrolment.co.uk/scheme-setup/pensionable-earnings/pensionable-earnings)

default_percentage.description: The company default percentage which will be applied to calculate the company amount of a contribution. It can be overwritten by the employee company amount.

signatories.description: A list of signatories (i.e. directors) of the company who will sign the Participation Agreement with Smart Pension.

admins.description: A list of administrators of the company who will be able to manage the pension scheme.

code.description: An error code used to easily reference errors.

title.description: A human-readable description of the error.

source.description: Used to indicate which part of the request document caused the error.

pointer.description: Path-like attribute which shows what is the actual attribute causing the error to be raised.

opt_state.description: **Available for PATCH requests only**. The opt_state describes whether the employee is an active member of the scheme. All available transitions between `opt_states` are described in the [Opt state transition flow documentation](http://developers.autoenrolment.co.uk/docs/opt-state-transitions).

opt_out_window_starts_on.description: The start of opt out period of the employee. The opt out window length is 1 calendar month (e.g. 6th May to 5th June). The `opt_out_window_starts_on` is ignored if the employee `opt_state` is not `opted_in` or `rejoined`.

ends_on.description: The employee end employment date or date of death. It is recommended to used when the employee left the employment or passed away only. In order to *cease membership*, update the `opt_state`.

exit_reason.description: The employee exit reason. Required if `ends_on` is provided. Rather than using the **"Ceased active membership, employee still employed"** option, update the `opt_state` to *ceased_membership*.
enum: Ceased active membership, employee still employed

company_percentage.description: The company contribution percentage for the employee. It will override the company default percentage.

company_match.description: Define if the company percentage will match the employee percentage when `percentage` is less than `company_percentage`. e.g. `percentage` is 3% and `company_percentage` is 5%: if `company_match` is true, all contributions created for the employee will have employee `percentage` and `company_percentage` set to 3%, otherwise the provided percentages will be applied.

group_id.description: The id of the group the employee belongs to.

works_in_uk.description: Defines if the employee works in the UK. If `false`, the employer has no duties against the employee.

contribute_if_entitled.description: Defines if the employer will contribute if the employee category is Entitled worker.

customer_id.description: The id of the customer account the employee is linked to. It will allow the employee to switch between the two accounts on the Smart Pension website.

external_id.description: A reference to link the employee to an external system such as a payroll software. It must be provided if the company wants to upload contributions via Papdis. Please note: avoid using values with leading zeros e.g. 0000123. All leading zeros will be removed by our system while uploding a Papdis file or a sreadsheet.

fund_id.description: The id of fund the employee has chosen to invest contributions to. Please note: the default value is based on `date_of_birth`, but can be overridden.

path.description: An endpoint path you want to submit the request to.

http_method.description: The HTTP method you want to use. Allowed methods: GET, PATCH, POST, DELETE.

data.description: The json body of the request. Must be provided if the `http_method` is PATCH or POST.

deferral_on.description: This is the date where the employee must be assessed. It can be up to 3 months after the employee's original enrolment date (i.e. either the company scheme start date or the employee's employment start date).

approved.description: It defines whether the request to join the scheme is accepted by the employer.
